trans-unit.source: Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

trans-unit.source: [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448) is a run-time verification tool that increases the effectiveness of your driver testing.
trans-unit.target: [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448) is a run-time verification tool that increases the effectiveness of your driver testing.

trans-unit.source: You can enable and configure Driver Verifier to run on all test computers when you deploy your driver for testing.
trans-unit.target: You can enable and configure Driver Verifier to run on all test computers when you deploy your driver for testing.

trans-unit.source: You should always set up a kernel mode debugging connection with the test computer when you enable Driver Verifier on the remote test computer.
trans-unit.target: You should always set up a kernel mode debugging connection with the test computer when you enable Driver Verifier on the remote test computer.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring a target computer and setting up a debug cable, see [Setting Up Kernel-Mode Debugging in Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/hh439376.
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring a target computer and setting up a debug cable, see [Setting Up Kernel-Mode Debugging in Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/hh439376.

trans-unit.source: Setting Driver Verifier properties for driver package projects
trans-unit.target: Setting Driver Verifier properties for driver package projects

trans-unit.source: Open the property pages for your driver package.
trans-unit.target: Open the property pages for your driver package.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click **Driver Verification**.
trans-unit.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click **Driver Verification**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Enable Driver Verification** option.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Enable Driver Verification** option.

trans-unit.source: When this option is selected, you can select the driver or drivers to verify on the test computer and you can select the [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448) options to use.
trans-unit.target: When this option is selected, you can select the driver or drivers to verify on the test computer and you can select the [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448) options to use.

trans-unit.source: Project Configuration and Platform
trans-unit.target: Project Configuration and Platform

trans-unit.source: The configuration list and platform list let you apply different deployment settings for different project configuration and platform combinations.
trans-unit.target: The configuration list and platform list let you apply different deployment settings for different project configuration and platform combinations.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can deploy a driver to one test computer using a set of deployment options for debug builds and to a different test computer using deployment options for release builds.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can deploy a driver to one test computer using a set of deployment options for debug builds and to a different test computer using deployment options for release builds.

trans-unit.source: Enable Driver Verifier
trans-unit.target: Enable Driver Verifier

trans-unit.source: You can enable Driver Verifier on the test computer for all drivers on the computer, for the driver project only, or for a list of specified drivers.
trans-unit.target: You can enable Driver Verifier on the test computer for all drivers on the computer, for the driver project only, or for a list of specified drivers.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might want to enable Driver Verifier for the set of drivers on the stack for a particular device.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might want to enable Driver Verifier for the set of drivers on the stack for a particular device.

trans-unit.source: Verify Drivers
trans-unit.target: Verify Drivers

trans-unit.source: Specifies which driver or drivers to verify on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: Specifies which driver or drivers to verify on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: All Drivers
trans-unit.target: All Drivers

trans-unit.source: Specifies that Driver Verifier verifies all installed drivers on the remote test computer.
trans-unit.target: Specifies that Driver Verifier verifies all installed drivers on the remote test computer.

trans-unit.source: Project Output
trans-unit.target: Project Output

trans-unit.source: Specifies that Driver Verifier verifies the driver project installed on the remote test computer.
trans-unit.target: Specifies that Driver Verifier verifies the driver project installed on the remote test computer.

trans-unit.source: This is the default option.
trans-unit.target: This is the default option.

trans-unit.source: Driver List
trans-unit.target: Driver List

trans-unit.source: Specifies the driver or list of drivers that Driver Verifier verifies on the remote test computer.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the driver or list of drivers that Driver Verifier verifies on the remote test computer.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could list all of the drivers associated with a particular device.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could list all of the drivers associated with a particular device.

trans-unit.source: Specify the drivers by binary name, for example, Driver.sys.
trans-unit.target: Specify the drivers by binary name, for example, Driver.sys.

trans-unit.source: Use a semicolon to separate a list of drivers.
trans-unit.target: Use a semicolon to separate a list of drivers.

trans-unit.source: Wildcard values, such as *n\*.sys*, are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Wildcard values, such as *n\*.sys*, are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Driver Verifier Standard Flags
trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier Standard Flags

trans-unit.source: You can configure the following Driver Verifier options on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the following Driver Verifier options on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: [DDI compliance checking](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh454208) (Windows 8)
trans-unit.target: [DDI compliance checking](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh454208) (Windows 8)

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier applies a set of device driver interface (DDI) rules that check for the proper interaction between a driver and the kernel interface of the operating system.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier applies a set of device driver interface (DDI) rules that check for the proper interaction between a driver and the kernel interface of the operating system.

trans-unit.source: Deadlock detection
trans-unit.target: Deadlock detection

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier monitors the driver's use of spin locks, mutexes, and fast mutexes.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier monitors the driver's use of spin locks, mutexes, and fast mutexes.

trans-unit.source: This detects whether the driver's code has the potential for causing a deadlock at some point.
trans-unit.target: This detects whether the driver's code has the potential for causing a deadlock at some point.

trans-unit.source: DMA verification
trans-unit.target: DMA verification

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier monitors the driver's use of direct memory access (DMA) routines.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier monitors the driver's use of direct memory access (DMA) routines.

trans-unit.source: This detects improper use of DMA buffers, adapters, and map registers.
trans-unit.target: This detects improper use of DMA buffers, adapters, and map registers.

trans-unit.source: Force IRQL checking
trans-unit.target: Force IRQL checking

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier places extreme memory pressure on the driver by invalidating pageable code.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier places extreme memory pressure on the driver by invalidating pageable code.

trans-unit.source: If the driver attempts to access paged memory at the wrong IRQL or while holding a spin lock, Driver Verifier detects this behavior.
trans-unit.target: If the driver attempts to access paged memory at the wrong IRQL or while holding a spin lock, Driver Verifier detects this behavior.

trans-unit.source: I/O verification
trans-unit.target: I/O verification

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier allocates the driver's Interrupt Request Packets (IRPs) from a special pool, and monitors the driver's I/O handling.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier allocates the driver's Interrupt Request Packets (IRPs) from a special pool, and monitors the driver's I/O handling.

trans-unit.source: This detects illegal or inconsistent use of I/O routines.
trans-unit.target: This detects illegal or inconsistent use of I/O routines.

trans-unit.source: Driver Verifier also monitors the calls of several I/O Manager routines and performs stress testing of Plug-and-Play (PnP) IRPs, power IRPs and WMI IRPs.
trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier also monitors the calls of several I/O Manager routines and performs stress testing of Plug-and-Play (PnP) IRPs, power IRPs and WMI IRPs.

trans-unit.source: Miscellaneous checks
trans-unit.target: Miscellaneous checks

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier looks for common causes of driver crashes, such as the mishandling of freed memory.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier looks for common causes of driver crashes, such as the mishandling of freed memory.

trans-unit.source: Pool tracking
trans-unit.target: Pool tracking

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier checks to see whether the driver has freed all of its memory allocations when it is unloaded.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier checks to see whether the driver has freed all of its memory allocations when it is unloaded.

trans-unit.source: This reveals memory leaks.
trans-unit.target: This reveals memory leaks.

trans-unit.source: Security checks
trans-unit.target: Security checks

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier looks for common errors that can result in security vulnerabilities, such as a reference to user-mode addresses by kernel-mode routines.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier looks for common errors that can result in security vulnerabilities, such as a reference to user-mode addresses by kernel-mode routines.

trans-unit.source: Special pool checking
trans-unit.target: Special pool checking

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier allocates most of the driver's memory requests from a special pool.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier allocates most of the driver's memory requests from a special pool.

trans-unit.source: This special pool is monitored for memory overruns, memory underruns, and memory that is accessed after it is freed.
trans-unit.target: This special pool is monitored for memory overruns, memory underruns, and memory that is accessed after it is freed.

trans-unit.source: Driver Verifier Scenario Specific Settings
trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier Scenario Specific Settings

trans-unit.source: Low resources simulation
trans-unit.target: Low resources simulation

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier randomly fails pool allocation requests and other resource requests.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier randomly fails pool allocation requests and other resource requests.

trans-unit.source: By injecting these allocation faults into the system, Driver Verifier tests the driver's ability to cope with a low-resource situation.
trans-unit.target: By injecting these allocation faults into the system, Driver Verifier tests the driver's ability to cope with a low-resource situation.

trans-unit.source: Force pending I/O requests
trans-unit.target: Force pending I/O requests

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier tests the driver's response to STATUS\_PENDING return values by returning STATUS\_PENDING for random calls to [**IoCallDriver**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff548336).
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier tests the driver's response to STATUS\_PENDING return values by returning STATUS\_PENDING for random calls to [**IoCallDriver**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff548336).

trans-unit.source: IRP logging
trans-unit.target: IRP logging

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier monitors a driver's use of IRPs and creates a log of IRP use.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier monitors a driver's use of IRPs and creates a log of IRP use.

trans-unit.source: [Invariant MDL Checking for Stack](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974663) (Windows 8)
trans-unit.target: [Invariant MDL Checking for Stack](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974663) (Windows 8)

trans-unit.source: The [Invariant MDL Checking for Stack](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974663) option monitors how the driver handles invariant MDL buffers across the driver stack.
trans-unit.target: The [Invariant MDL Checking for Stack](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974663) option monitors how the driver handles invariant MDL buffers across the driver stack.

trans-unit.source: Driver Verifier can detect illegal modification of invariant MDL buffers.
trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier can detect illegal modification of invariant MDL buffers.

trans-unit.source: To use this option, I/O Verification must be enabled on at least one driver.
trans-unit.target: To use this option, I/O Verification must be enabled on at least one driver.

trans-unit.source: [Invariant MDL Checking for Driver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974662) (Windows 8)
trans-unit.target: [Invariant MDL Checking for Driver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974662) (Windows 8)

trans-unit.source: The [Invariant MDL Checking for Driver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974662) option monitors how the driver handles invariant MDL buffers on a per-driver basis.
trans-unit.target: The [Invariant MDL Checking for Driver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974662) option monitors how the driver handles invariant MDL buffers on a per-driver basis.

trans-unit.source: This option detects illegal modification of invariant MDL buffers.
trans-unit.target: This option detects illegal modification of invariant MDL buffers.

trans-unit.source: To use this option, you must enable I/O Verification on at least one driver.
trans-unit.target: To use this option, you must enable I/O Verification on at least one driver.

trans-unit.source: [Power Framework Delay Fuzzing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh454184) (Windows 8)
trans-unit.target: [Power Framework Delay Fuzzing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh454184) (Windows 8)

trans-unit.source: When this option is active, Driver Verifier randomizes thread schedules to help flush out concurrency errors in the driver.
trans-unit.target: When this option is active, Driver Verifier randomizes thread schedules to help flush out concurrency errors in the driver.

trans-unit.source: [Stack Based Failure Injection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974664) (Windows 8)
trans-unit.target: [Stack Based Failure Injection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974664) (Windows 8)

trans-unit.source: The [Stack Based Failure Injection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974664) option injects resource failures in kernel-mode drivers.
trans-unit.target: The [Stack Based Failure Injection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974664) option injects resource failures in kernel-mode drivers.

trans-unit.source: This option uses a special driver, KmAutoFail.sys, in conjunction with [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448) to penetrate driver error handling paths.
trans-unit.target: This option uses a special driver, KmAutoFail.sys, in conjunction with [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448) to penetrate driver error handling paths.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You cannot combine [Stack Based Failure Injection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974664) with [Low resources simulation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff548288).
trans-unit.target: **Note** You cannot combine [Stack Based Failure Injection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh974664) with [Low resources simulation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff548288).

trans-unit.source: Driver Verifier options that require I/O Verification
trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier options that require I/O Verification

trans-unit.source: There are four options that require you to first enable [I/O Verification](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff548045).
trans-unit.target: There are four options that require you to first enable [I/O Verification](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff548045).

trans-unit.source: If I/O Verification is not enabled, these options are not enabled.
trans-unit.target: If I/O Verification is not enabled, these options are not enabled.

trans-unit.source: Force Pending I/O Requests
trans-unit.target: Force Pending I/O Requests

trans-unit.source: IRP Logging
trans-unit.target: IRP Logging

trans-unit.source: Invariant MDL Checking for Stack
trans-unit.target: Invariant MDL Checking for Stack

trans-unit.source: Invariant MDL Checking for Driver
trans-unit.target: Invariant MDL Checking for Driver
